Player History
Injured on 8/18/1975 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for 3 weeks...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 1/31/1976 (Going to LA: P D. Spillner. Going to PHI: 3B M. Kakefu, RF J. Youngblood)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1976, off Gene Garber (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/8/1976, off Vince Colbert (STL)...
Injured on 5/24/1978 with a Strained Tricep Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 10/2/1978 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/18/1979 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Los Angeles on 6/2/1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/9/1980, hitting .464 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1981, hitting .455 with 3 HR, 12 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1982, hitting .667 with 1 HR, 11 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1983, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1984...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1985, hitting .351 with 6 HR, 23 RBI...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Injured on 10/1/1985 with a Pulled Thigh Muscle, out for one week...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against St. Louis on 4/14/1986...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1986...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 6/13/1988, off Scott Garrelts (LA)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/14/1989, hitting .435 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Atlanta on 4/19/1989...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against New York (N) on 5/19/1989...
Drove in 6 runs against Cincinnati on 8/16/1989...
Released by Philadelphia on 1/31/1990...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/11/1990 to a 3-year deal worth $9,500,000 per year...
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1990...
Drove in 6 runs against Baltimore on 6/28/1991...
